chinese: 雨打倒了无数的高粱，雨在田野里狂欢，蛤蟆躲在高粱根下，哈达哈达地抖着颌下雪白的皮肤； 狐狸蹲在幽暗的洞里，看着从高粱上飞溅而下的细小水珠，道路很快就泥泞不堪，杂草伏地，矢车菊清醒地擎着湿漉漉的头。
english: Sorghum crumpled under the wild rain. Toads took refuge under the stalks, their white pouches popping in and out noisily; foxes hid in their darkened dens to watch tiny drops of water splashing down from the sorghum plants.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: The rains beat down upon countless high-corn stalks, and the fields sang as they danced. The hens were hiding beneath the stalks of the corn, their beak shaking with snow-white skin. The fox was sitting at a dimly lit cave, looking at the small drops that fell from the tall stalks, which soon turned the road into a muddy mess. The weeds had already grown on the path; the tulip flowers stood upright and misted their heads.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: Puddles of sorghum were hitting their backs as rain beat down on the countryside; Toads hiding in the roots, they scolded them with white fur, those little felines pounced upon tiny drops falling from the sorghum stalks, the path quickly became caked in mud, thistle and bindweed stood tall, the olives擎着从滴水中溅起的鲜红头颅。

unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: The rain beat against countless sorghum plants, causing them to dance in the field; tadpoles hid under the stalks, shaking off the dew as they did so, their white fur glimmering like snow; foxes crouched in dark dens, watching tiny drops of water fly through the air; the path became muddy, grass bowed down as though in submission, and hornflower opened up its wet petals gracefully.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: The rain destroyed countless high-corn fields, and it was dancing on the fields, with the hens hiding under the stalks of the corn, making a noise like a whale. The fox was sitting in the dark caves and looking at the tiny drops that had fallen from the high-corn stalks, and the mud was already covering the roads. There were no weeds growing beneath the leaves, but the fox was holding up the heads of the daisy-flowering flowers. The flower was waking up, its head wet from the small drops falling from the stalks.

chinese: 那刘老老先听见告艰苦，只当是没想头了， 又听见给他二十两银子，喜的眉开眼笑道：“我们也知道艰难的，但只俗语说的：‘瘦死的骆驼比马还大’呢。
english: When Grannie Liu heard Xi-feng talk about 'difficulties' she concluded that there was no hope. 'We knew you had your troubles,' she said, 'but as the saying goes, 'A starved camel is bigger than a fat horse.'
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: That Liu Gege had heard of his hardship before, just like he was not thinking about it anymore, but when he heard that he got twenty two baos, he smiled happily and said, "We know the hard times, but what people say is: ‘A horse that has no head is bigger than a horse with a head’."

unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: That Liu Lao was first taken by surprise because he heard that it was a difficult matter; but upon hearing that he would be given twenty silver dollars, he burst out laughing and said, "We know that difficulties can also become very great."

unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: That is why Liu Yong heard that he was very hard hit, thinking that it was not his head that mattered. Then he heard that he got twenty yuan for him, smiling with delight. "We know how difficult it is; but just as old folks say: 'A horse is bigger than a man'."

'I know how hard it is,' she said. 'But as the old saying goes, "scourge of the thin man beats scabby wretches' . . .'
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: Liu was so happy that he smiled from ear to ear when he heard the man's words: "We know how difficult life is too. Just as the old saying goes: 'A skinny camel is bigger than a fat one'."

chinese: 她有一次夜半被叫醒。 人们早已入睡，那叫声便显得格外惊动，带着些危急和恐怖。 王琦瑶的心擂鼓似的怦怦响着，她睡衣外面披上件夹袄便下楼去开门，见是两个乡下人，抬了一个担架，躺着垂危的病人，说是请王医师救命。

chinese: 轿夫们停住，呆呆地看着劈腿横在路当中的劫路人。 那人身材不高，脸上涂着黑墨，头戴一顶高粱篾片编成的斗笠，身披一件大蓑衣，蓑衣敞着，露出密扣黑衣和拦腰扎着的宽腰带。 腰里别着一件用红绸布包起的鼓鼓囊囊的东西。

chinese: 对，对，郡主娘娘，咱们刻好之后，我牵了你去长安门大街，大叫：‘哪一位客官要印乌龟？ 三文钱印一张！’
english: Ah, yes, Little Countess, I know what. When the carving's ready, I'll be able to take you out into Changan Street and set up there as a print-seller. 'Roll up, roll up!' I'll say. 'Buy a nice turtle print, three cash a sheet!'

unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: Yes, yes, my lady county, after we made it, I will take you to Chang'an City Street, calling out: ‘Who is the customer who wants to make a tortoise? Three copper coins for one!’

chinese: 有一天在山上，我正好借了罗小四的汽枪，队长家的母狗正好跑到山上叫我看见，我就射出一颗子弹打瞎了它的右眼。
english: One day as I walked on the mountain, the team leader's dog came into view. I happened to have Luo Xiaosi's air rifle with me, so I fired a bullet and blinded her right eye.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: One day, I happened to borrow a gun from Li Xiaowu’s mother when I was on top of a mountain. When I saw her coming up, she shot out a bullet at the dog that was sitting on the mountain.

unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: One day on a mountain I happened to borrow Ruo Xiaos four's shotgun. The mother dog of the captain's family ran up to me and I shot it with a bullet that hit its right eye.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: One day I borrowed an air rifle from Luo Xiaosi. The team leader's dog happened to run up the mountain and see me, so I fired a bullet right into its right eye.

unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): One day on the mountain, I did exactly as I was lent the stick for, only this time the team leader's dog was running after me and the team leader himself showed up at my doorstep with a giant feline fang about his neck, telling me to kill the one thing that would make her jump up and throw her right head out of the slope.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: One day on a mountain, I happened to borrow Liu Xiaosuo's shotgun from his father, and the mother dog of the captain ran up the hill and saw me, so I shot it with a bullet, killing its right eye.

chinese: 它原先是一片蛮荒地，荆榛苇茅丛生，狐狸野兔的乐园，后来有了几架牧人的草棚，后来逃来了杀人命犯、落魄酒徒、亡命赌棍…… 他们建造房屋，开垦荒地，拓扑出人的乐园，狐狸野兔迁徙他乡，临别时齐声发出控诉人类的鸣叫。
english: At one time the site had been a wasteland covered with brambles, underbrush, and reeds, a paradise for foxes and wild rabbits. Then a few huts appeared, and it became a haven for escaped murderers, drunks, gamblers, who built homes, cultivated the land, and turned it into a paradise for humans, forcing out the foxes and wild rabbits, who set up howls of protest on the eve of their departure.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: It was once a desolate place covered with thorn bushes, rabbit's nest, foxes and rabbits, but it became a few barns for some men of business. They built houses, cultivated land, and planted gardens where human beings lived. The animals migrated from one place to another, each making their final voice heard as they left. "A call from the heavens" was heard.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: In the beginning it was a barren spot, full of willows and foxes and herons. Then one of the farmers' huts came along. They began to build houses, cultivate the land, and indulge themselves in gambling and drinking. Calling out, they exasperatedly condemned human life, as they fled from each other. The foxes and sheeps were the first to depart—the people who spoke last rushed off together, their cries joining in the condemnations: 'To humans, human life! Humans! Humans!'
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: It was originally a wild land where thorny brambles and reeds grew, the hunting grounds of foxes and rabbits. Later it had several shepherd's huts, and then came murderers, runaways from hell, and gamblers who were lost at sea… They built houses, cleared out the land, and turned it into a human paradise. The foxes and rabbits moved away and cried out with a collective voice against mankind.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: A desolate expanse it was, teeming with hares and foxes and wild rabbits; then people came, building villages and farms, and scattering it throughout the countryside inhabited by foxes and rabbits.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: It was once a barren place, where thorn bushes and wildflowers grew, where the felines and rabbits roamed, and where they lived in the presence of the foxes and rabbits. But later on, there were houses built for farmers, and people came from all directions to seek shelter in these homes. They constructed their houses and cultivated farmland, creating a garden of human life, where foxes and rabbits migrated to other parts of the land. When they say goodbye, they all sing together, echoing the cry of humans.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): Before, it was a barren field dominated by tethers of willows and ivy, home to foxes and shepherds whose thatched hut were later razed to be replaced by new houses, fields for sheep and cattle, and弃民携妻带子逃上大田，一群羊羔一只只飞回家中，那天夜间他们都高唱着动物的鸣叫声。
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: It was originally a wild area of thorny brambles, reeds, and rushes, a paradise for foxes and rabbits. Later, there were several shepherd's huts, and then came out killers, vagabonds, and gamblers who had fallen on hard times… They built houses and cultivated land, and they created human paradise. The foxes and rabbits moved away, leaving behind their plaintive cries as they departed.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): A desolate wilderness once covered with bushes, shrubs, and reeds, it was once a free-for-all home to foxes, hares, and other game animals. Later, scattered grass huts were added by farmers who had fled from their duties; then, homeless murderers, drunkards, gamblers who had lost all sense of shame and self-respect had come to call this area their home. Before long, the foxes and rabbits migrated away,哀嚎着告别这里。

chinese: 村里街道上也水深及膝，骡马牛羊都泡在水里，水上漂着牲畜们稀薄的排泄物。
english: The water in the village was knee-high, covering the legs of livestock, whose waste floated on the surface.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: In the village's streets, water was as deep as the knee of a horse or a mule or a pig or a lamb. The water was floating over the bodies of animals that had gone through the pails.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: The streets were underwater, and animals (horse, goat, buffalo, mule, calf) remained submerged while the waste products of their manure floated around like droplets of water.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: The streets of the village were flooded up to the knees with water too, horses, cows, and sheep floating on the water while their feces floated along.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: Village streets were flooded waist deep, bathing both people and animals; floating atop the water was the translucent waste matter of the animals.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: In the village's streets as well, water is deep enough that it goes up to the knees; horses, donkeys, sheep, goats, and livestock all sit in the water, spilling out their dirty butterscotch from the water.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): The streets were flooded all the way down to the hatches above the water, where buffalo, mules, and horses came soaking wet as their stables were filled with suds.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: The streets of the village were also flooded knee-deep with water; horses, mules, oxen, and sheep floated in the water, and the feces of the animals was floating on top of the water.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): On the main thoroughfare in the village, the water was waist deep, and mules, oxen, and sheep swam in it, floating their light waste floats atop the murky water.

chinese: 我在一边看完了才走。
english: I didn't leave until I witnessed the whole episode.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: I finished reading one chapter before I left.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: I finished reading my story before I left and quickly walked away from here.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: I finished reading it while I was watching.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: I finished reading it while you were gone.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: I watched the entire film before I left.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): As I finished reading, I left the office.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: I watched it from the beginning before I left.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): I finished reading it from the side.

chinese: 低头看去，宽阔笔直的马路上跑着如豆的汽车，成串的亮珠子。
english: Below, the cars speeding down the straight broad roads looked like a chain of pearls.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: As you look down at this scene, a broad road is lined with cars running like beans. There are dozens of bright lights on each one.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: As he looked down, a broad road was crossed by countless cars with images of dots on their roofs. There were fish tails of jewels going up in the sky.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Looking down, I saw a broad straight road with cars running like tiny lamps on it, all in rows.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: Lowering his head he saw broad, straight, traffic-filled roads where car lights snaking along were like the beans of little beans.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: Looking down at them, a large road full of cars running like beans. They were clustered like beads.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): As he looked down, a broad road was being plied by numerous cars, packed ends of peas, skittering together.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: Looking down, a wide straight road is filled with small cars running like beads of light, making up rows of bright spots.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): Lowering his head, he saw broad, straight roads filled with slender cars, moving like beads down a string,

chinese: 成名如此之早，当真古今罕有。”
english: To have won such fame, and so early in life too, is an almost unparalleled achievement.'
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: He was so early in his career that it is rare to find such a phenomenon in ancient times.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: And, naturally, not many people knew about him when he first became famous.'
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: So early a rise to fame? That's truly unprecedented."
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: To begin with at your age!'
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: It is so early for him to be famous that he has never been seen before in history."
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): And he did seem unusually successful when it came to launching his literary career.'
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: Such a famous name so early in life, truly unique in history.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): To become a famous scholar so early in life is indeed rare.'

chinese: 待雄飞高举，明冬再晤，岂非大快之事！”
english: How delightful it will be to meet again next winter when you have distinguished yourself by soaring to the top over all the other candidates!'
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: In winter, let me fly high and meet you again. What is this not a good thing!
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: Then, when their flights have reached new heights of splendor, our springtime reappearance should not be辜负! ’
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Let him fly high until winter comes again. Isn't it a great pleasure!"
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: When, next winter， when time to see you again, I hope all goes well here first, we can meet once more—what a happy thought!'
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: Wait for him to fly high, meet again next winter, isn’t that a good thing!"
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): And if they show us the soaring falcons again in the spring next year, what would we have got from a win-win for us!'
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: Wait for him to fly high, then meet again in the winter! How great will it be!"
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): When, next winter, we can meet face to face once more, imagine how pleasure that will be!'

chinese: 纵声大笑，身子跟着乱动，右腿一曲，右手已抓住了匕首柄，极慢极慢的从剑鞘中拔出，不发出丝毫声息，就算有了些微声，也教笑声给遮掩住了。
english: He kept up the artificial laughter in order to cover up the wriggling of his body. While he was talking and laughing he had managed to draw up his right leg so that he could get his hand on the dagger in his boot and draw it from its sheath. Any slight sound that this operation might have given rise to was masked by his idiotic cachinnation.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Silently laughing, his body moved in unison with a series of laughter-filled motions, his right leg twisting, and he was holding onto the blade's handle. chinese: 这是深入肌肤，已经谈不上是亲是近，反有些起腻，暗底里生畏的，却是有一股噬骨的感动。
english: This is a feeling that, having penetrated the flesh, goes beyond closeness. One begins to weary of it. It breeds a secret fear, but hidden within that fear is an excitement that gnaws down to the bone.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: This is a deep penetration into the skin, which doesn't seem to be close or near at all; perhaps it's a touchy subject, but there is something stirring within the dark corners that gives me fear.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: It feels more like being near someone's skin than its core; one has a摄魂魄般的感动。
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: This is skin-deep, not close enough for a kiss or a hug, but it has a kind of charm that makes you feel scared at your own back.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: To the extent that she was engaged, it could not anymore be called friendship—that intimate feeling between people for each other. It was becoming a bit boring, like a fearful but irresistible force that exerted an insidious pull upon her.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: This is skin deep, it doesn't really matter if it's close or far, but it seems to have a certain attraction towards something that makes its heart boil. Yet there's a strong, biting feeling within it which is almost like a gnawing bite. This is one of those things that leaves you with a cold, unflattering feeling.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): It goes beneath the skin and involves no mere familiarity; it is the deep, gnarled secret beneath the bone, where one is told of how a snake licks up a dead man and leaves a bloodstain on its jaws even after the meal has been finished.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: This is skin-deep, not a close or intimate relationship, but it's a bit too familiar, and there's a kind of fear that rises up inside you from the bottom of your heart – an indelible feeling of love.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): This fear was augmented by the gradual familiarity of the experience, until what was once unsettling was now merely a一股深处滋生的发毛的感觉。

chinese: 韦小宝见他不是向自己走来，暗暗舒了口气，心道：“老乌龟好厉害，眼睛虽然瞎了，居然能追到这里。”

He sighed inwardly, saying, "Old man Guo is indeed very powerful, even though his eyesight is bad, he still managed to catch up to me here."

'Huh!' he muttered to himself; 'He's not blind.' And then he thought: 'Old things like that! The Old Devil is actually able to get here after all!'
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Wu Xiaoya saw that he was not coming towards him, so he sighed inwardly. He thought, "Old tortoise is really strong. Although his eyes were blind, he could still catch up here."

chinese: 男的原来是个猎户，也采些药材，后来周围的林子越来越少，就种地了，但人们还是叫他齐猎头儿。

chinese: 不是吗？ 太空电梯其实就是一条运河，像巴拿马运河连接了两个大洋一样，太空电梯将地球和太空连接起来……”

unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: Don't think they don't? Actually, a space elevator is like a canal as well. Imagine the Panama Canal connecting two oceans; a space elevator would connect Earth and outer space....'
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: Is that so? The space elevator is like a canal connecting two oceans, like Panama Canal, which connects the Earth's surface and the outer space. It will connect the Earth and the outer space together...
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): Don't think so. The Exospace Lift is like the Panama Canal, which connects the two oceans. Like the Panama Canal, it links the earth with the universe....'
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: Isn't it? The space elevator is just a canal like the Panama Canal connecting two oceans, linking Earth with outer space…"
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): Didn't they? How does a hyperloop feel like a canal, connecting two oceans like the Panama Canal, but then connects Earth to space? . . .'

chinese: 你只顾一时为我得罪了人，他们都记在心里，遇着坎儿，说的好说不好听的，大家什么意思呢？”
english: You don't seem to realize. You offend people on my account and the next moment you've forgotten all about it. But they haven't. It's all scored up against me; and as soon as something goes a bit wrong, they come out with all these horrible things about me. It makes it so unpleasant for all of us.'
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Only because you were angry with me did they remember their words. When I am in trouble, what do you think of it? "What kind of words would you use when you meet a problem?"
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: Well, obviously you are too busy worrying about me at present to try to be nice to them. Nobody takes any notice of you if you are upset; and when there's a坎子儿, who is going to say 'good' things about you? I can't fathom why they take such a dislike to you.'
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: You only offend people for a moment, but they all keep it in their hearts. What do you mean if you say something good or bad when you're in trouble?"
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: When you upset people who know you, you can count on one hand the number of times they've thanked you for upsetting them – and how many times they'll find it easy to get at you and make you feel silly!
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: You only wanted to offend me at a moment's notice, but they will remember it forever. When I am in trouble, what kind of words do you think they use?
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): Well, obviously you have no influence over them; they all hold back their comments unless it is an important matter. Then, when it comes to the sort of comments they do make, none of them has much say.'
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: You're just going to get yourself into trouble for something I've done," she said, "and everyone will be saying bad things about you."
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): When people do wrong you once, they remember it all their lives. Some way or other, whatever the occasion, they will find some way of putting you up or down about it. By the time they get round to you, what, pray, would you expect from them?'

unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: As we often say, life is like a theater: people come and go. Although Madame Yan told them all about her secrets as though they were her potpourri, one could tell that some of them remained somewhat uncomfortable; Wang Qiyao, it seems, had something to keep private. Despite her boasting about having no secrets, she was surprised to find that her friends, who seemed to know everything about her, showed genuine understanding and compassion.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: Like friends who meet on the way, each with his own hidden inclinations, it's not surprising that the Ye family mother and father have something to hide; they don't know what is inside their minds and can't tell them where or when.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): People like Wang Qiyao and her friends who came and visited could hardly be described as easy to relate to; on the contrary, they went far out in some cases—and even their not-so-subtle intimates had no means of knowing what was going on behind the scenes that would enable them to call them on them. To show some civility, one should perhaps be a little more reserved about their innermost feelings.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: Like friends who met halfway, each with their own secrets, look at how Lady Zhen poured out her beans from a bamboo barrel – there may be some secrets she doesn’t know herself, but they don’t have much connection, so let’s just show some compassion for now.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): A true friend is one who tells you nothing but a lie; Madame Yan may have been forthright about keeping secrets, but she didn't realize that she had a heart condition. It's easy for us onlookers to be mistaken for her; after all, we were all fooled by her when we first met.

chinese: 韦小宝想问他什么叫神堂穴、环跳穴，如何点穴、解穴，但转念一想，自己是青木堂香主，又是总舵主的弟子，连点穴、解穴也不会，岂不是让下属们太也瞧不起？ 反正对付一个小姑娘总不是什么难事，点头道：“知道了。”
english: Trinket wanted to ask him where the Holy Hall and Ring Jump vital points were and how you closed and opened them; but then he remembered that, as Master of the Green Wood Lodge and a disciple of the great Helmsman, he was probably expected to know about these things and felt sure his subordinates would despise him if they found out that he was totally ignorant of these matters; so he just nodded and said that he would. 'Anyway, ' he thought, 'I shouldn't have any difficulty in handling her. She's only a girl.'
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Qian Xiaobang wanted him to explain what a "Shengmen Pavilion" and "Jihe Pavilion" are, how to point them out, and what to do with them, but when he thought about it, he was not able to point them out or deal with them. How could this be so bad for his subordinates? Anyway, dealing with a little girl wasn't too hard.点头应道："I know."
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: I get the feeling that these 'God Delights' 'they're-for-the-guardians' there's a god who does this,' Trinket said to himself. 'But I don't see how they can possibly know about circles and Loop-Points and such. Anyway, I've got a little Temple for gods to go to too—though I haven't had any experience of that myself. Anyway, it seems like enough trouble to trouble someone really easy-up.'
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Wu Xiaolai wanted to know what he meant by "God Hall Navel Point" and "Ring Point". He wondered how to press on the navel point and release it. But after thinking for a moment, as he was the head monk of the Green Wood Temple and the disciple of the Grand Master, he couldn't even do these things himself. How could his subordinates look down upon him? In any case, dealing with a little girl wouldn't be too difficult. Wu Xiaolai nodded and said, "I've got it."
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: Trinket was about asking the Helmsman what the God-In-Hand and the Ring-Way were, and how to press them home and how to relieve the effects of pressure, but算了算自己是青木堂的领导人物,又是舵主的徒儿,如果搞不清楚点穴和解穴这些玩意,人家会小看我么,于是管不了那么多了,点了点头:「知道了。」
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct:
I have just translated your request from Chinese into English, but I will not include any other words or phrases. Here is my translation:

1. "What does a heaven's temple point mean? How do you point it, how do you release it?" But thinking about this, I realize that I am a grandmaster of the Jade Tree Sect, which was my senior disciple's senior master, so I would never be able to perform these things.

2. "How can I point it out to you?" I nodded my head, knowing what I had to say already.

3. "No, I don't think so." I simply nodded my head as well.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): I get what 'the sacred hall' is called,' Trinket said to Trinkhuan as they stood facing the stone pillar which seemed to speak to them; 'But I don't see how 'the drum-closing point' and 'the drum-unrolling point' work. And I don't know how to use it. It seems too much trouble to solve a little girl's problem, do you think so, Brother?'
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: Wu Xiaogang wanted to ask him what it meant by Shengtang meridian and Huantiao meridian, how to point them out, and how to unblock them. But he thought of his status as a Young Master of the Yellow Wood Hall and the disciple of the Grandmaster, and he didn’t know how to point out or unblock them either. Isn’t that letting subordinates look down upon? After all, dealing with a little girl wasn’t a difficult thing, so he nodded his head and said, “I’ve got it.”
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): Trinket wanted to ask her what these acupoints were (Godfather's Claw and Ring Jump), how they were to be pointed and how to find out that sort of thing, but he decided it would be more impressive to show off his own limited skills. 'I get it,' he said, deferring to her authority. 'Thanks.'

chinese: 轿夫们的话更加粗野了，他们有的骂我外曾祖父是个见钱眼开的小人，有的说鲜花插到牛粪上，有的说单扁郎是个流白脓淌黄水的麻风病人。
english: The bearers' banter turned coarse. One of them reviled my great-granddad for being a money-grabber, another said something about a pretty flower stuck into a pile of cowshit, a third called Shan Bianlang a scruffy leper who oozed pus and excreted yellow fluids.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: The men who spoke in Mandarin were more coarse than usual. They had said things like "I don't know why you're so greedy," and "flowers should be placed on top of a dung heap, not on the floor." And they also said that "a thin man named Xiao Lu is a patient with meningitis" (which means he has meningitis).
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: They became even crude, attributing my grandfather's poor moral character to his short-sighted view of money; criticizing him on whether his flowers had placed a cow-pat on his boot, others going so far as to accuse his son of leeches which were soaking the cow-pat with yellow pus.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: The men who were carrying me along looked more vulgar now, some of them called my great-grandfather a gold-digger, others said I was like a flower stuck to dung, and still others said that I was a leper with blisters and yellow pus.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: The bearers became more coarse: one said that Granddad was a nosy little person who cared only about money; another compared the flowers to manure and called Single on leprosy.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: The word of the porter was more coarse than before; they had said that I should be a little person with eyes for money, that flowers were placed on dung, and that single man was a sick patient with a yellow tongue and a white脓疮。
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): They became even rudenessful; one old man骂我说我的祖父只看钱走运,一场洋马趴牛屎便趴牛粪;另一个人说王文义是烂wangwu,躺在猪草里;另外一人说单扁郎是个麻风病人,因为他的草都烂掉了头破血流。
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: The words of the cab drivers grew more coarse. Some said my great-great-grandfather was a small-minded money-grubber, while others said that flowers were put on dung heaps, some called me a "white man's disease," and some even said I was a "mad dog with leprosy."
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): The bearers became more coarse: one said that Aroma's grandfather was a deal-seeker who cared only about money; another said that since Freckles had been sick with leprosy his mother had dressed up his wounds with white clay and yellow plaster; yet another went so far as to say that Frecles was a leper who'd been treated with white clay and yellow plaster.

unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: Yes,' said Xi-feng. 'A man is a man after all. He'll be attracted to one if he hasn't already been attracted to another.'

chinese: 这一晚是国庆夜，有哪幢楼的平台上，放起礼花，孤零零的一朵，在湛黑的天空上缓缓地舒开叶瓣，又缓缓凋零成细细的流星，渐渐消失，空中还留有一团浅白的影。
english: The party took place on the evening of National Day and fireworks were being set off from one of the balconies. A single rocket shot up into the darkness and slowly unfurled its fiery petals in the night sky before breaking up into a stream of falling stars, which vanished slowly, leaving a faint white shadow in the sky.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: This evening is National Day, and there was a light show on the platform that had been set up at night. There was a lone flower floating slowly in the black sky. Its petals slowly unfolded and then faded into thin streaks, slowly becoming smaller as they disappeared over the horizon. A faint white outline still remained in the distance.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: It was a late night国庆节，syncrosmes of apartments launch forth huge torches of fireworks, one for each floor. In the darkness of the sky, a lone star opens its petals and with fades into nothing but tiny shooting stars, bright white streaks that swirl toward the earth again before dissipating into an image of pure white.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: This was the night of the National Day holiday, on which a flower was set up on each platform. It opened slowly, then gradually turned into a small bright dot before it disappeared from the sky. In its place remained a pale white cloud.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: It was a night of the Fall Day holiday. In every apartment platform somewhere outside that city there was a fireworks display; but in this city there is not another apartment building. Still, as the final splashes of light fade into darkness, a silvery white curtain hangs above the emptiness, slowly dissolving into shapeless flakes that gradually disappear into the air.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: This evening was National Day, and there were fireworks on the platform that had been lit up by a single house. A lone flower lay suspended in the black sky, slowly unfolding its petals and turning to dust as it slowly fell down to earth, leaving behind a faint white trail.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): It was a late night国庆节，syncopated celebrations were being thrown out onto every platform—the rooftop house hosting a display of fireworks—but empty as possible, stars obscured by darkness, and the firework drops slowly fading into nothingness, like a streak of white shadows remaining on the sky.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: This night was National Day. Which building’s platform had the firecrackers lit? A lone flower slowly opens its petals and then gradually withers into a fine line of stars before it vanishes from the sky. There is still a faint white shadow left behind in the sky.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): It was Night of the Singles, a holiday night when every building on the street could be heard setting off firecrackers; here was only the lone presence of a single blossom, whose petals slowly unfurled like thin white flakes floating slowly to the ground, until in the end a faint snow of white fluff was all that remained in the dark sky.

chinese: 唉，睡觉的时候以后可多着呢，朝也睡，晚也睡，睡着了永远不醒。

unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: Well, now I can fall asleep any time, day or night, and wake up refreshed.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: Oh, when you sleep at night, there will be lots of dreams too, from dawn till dusk, until you wake up in the morning.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): Well, we'd better start sleeping whenever we get up—every night! We can sleep until our eyes turn gray, never to wake up again.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: Ah, there will be plenty of sleeping after sleep. I'll sleep when I'm sleepy, and I'll sleep no matter what time it is.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): Well, now I can get a good night's sleep. I'll wake up forever, never more to wake up.

chinese: 只因素日闻得人说，嫂子是个利害人，在你跟前一点也错不得，所以唬住我了。 我如今见嫂子是个有说有笑极疼人的，我怎么不来?
english: True, there was a time when I should have been scared to come, because people always told me what a holy terror you were and how dangerous it was to cross you; but now I know that in reality you are all gentleness and fun, there is nothing that could stop me coming.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Only factors heard from her husband said that the wife is a person of importance, and if you were present she would not make any mistake, so I fooled around with her. Now that I see her as someone who makes people smile and has a heart of gold, how come I did not come?
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: Hadn't she heard that there were a number of nuns in your family who were very serious and kind-hearted? So I was afraid that I had committed a great error when I mentioned her name; yet I now realize that she is the sort of person whose warmth of heart and good nature makes you want nothing more than to take her on as a little guide. I can't go now, really, but I think it would be wonderful to see her.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Only because I heard that my aunt was a dangerous person when I was with you, so she frightened me. Now I see that she is a loving and cheerful aunt who loves me very much. How could I not come here?
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: Heard enough bad things about you, on this trip, to be quite sure that if I were to go seeing you now, I should be a very stupid fool; so I come here instead, where you are acting so kindly towards me, and finding yourself so eager to see me, to change my mind.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: Based on the Chinese text you provided, it seems like there might be a misunderstanding or some other issue that occurred between the speaker and the listener. The speaker is mentioning someone named "嫂子" who they think has a negative influence on them, but when they're talking to their friend, they find out that she's actually very kind and makes people smile. They wonder why this happened, so they want to know what they can do about it.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): I only know that during the days that I have been hearing her from, this Nannie Dai has been a rather dangerous one, and has now made me want to see your mother much more than usual. She told me that she used to smile pleasantly and treated you very kindly—and so I'm going to try and get her in.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: Only when I heard that the woman had a bad temper did I think of my sister-in-law, who was not wrong in front of me. Now that I see her is so pleasant and loving, how can I not come?
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): Heard people saying your a smart set, dear; you must be a smart set indeed, for I am afraid I should have missed something if I didn't take my time to see you. Now that I have seen you, I can understand quite easily why you are so charming and why I haven't missed you.'

chinese: 父亲，一九五七年，你躲在我家里间屋里那个地洞里时，你每日每夜，在永恒的黑暗中，追忆流水年月，你至少三百六十次想到了我们家那几十间房屋的屋盖在大火中塌落的情景。 你想到你的父亲我的爷爷在那时刻想到了什么，我的幻想紧追着你的幻想，你的幻想紧追着爷爷的思维。
english: Father, when you were hiding in the burrow we dug for you in the floor of my home back in 1957, you recalled those days of your past in the unrelenting darkness. On no fewer than 365 occasions, in your mind you saw the roof of your house crash down amid the flames, and wondered what was going through the mind of your father, my granddad. So my fantasies were chasing yours while yours were chasing Granddad's.

unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: Father, in 1957, when you burrowed into that underground cell to escape in my home, you recalled the fleeting moments of your life in excess of three hundred sixty times, imagining yourself counting数着火势吞噬几十间房屋屋顶的时间; your imagination chased me down and then chased Granddad's thoughts.

Your imagination followed my obsession, and my obsession followed his notion.

chinese: 我办过一个盗窃案，罪犯能把行驶中的列车中间的一节车厢偷了，前后的其余部分又完好地接起来开到终点站，用的工具只是一根钢丝绳和几只铁钩子。
english: I once handled a robbery where the criminals managed to steal one car out of a moving train. They reconnected the cars before and after the one they were interested in so that the train got all the way to its destination without anyone noticing. The only tools they used were a length of wire cable and a few steel hooks.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: I committed a theft, which was carried out by a criminal who could steal from the middle of a train car without leaving any damage behind it, and then replace it with other parts after they had been put back together at the end of the journey. The tools used were just a piece of steel rope and a few iron hooks.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: I committed a robbery several times. The robber would steal a section of车厢， restore restrooms within, and send them out, with the use of a raw steel rope and a few iron hooks.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: I've handled a theft case where a thief stole one of the carriages between two cars on a running train, while the other parts were perfectly intact and connected up to the next station, using only a piece of steel wire and a few hooks.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: I solved a theft case where the criminal had ripped out a section of the train en route and replaced it with something else while the rest of the train continued to its destination. He'd done this using only a steel rope and a few iron hooks.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: I committed a theft several years ago. The thief could steal one of the remaining sections of each car at the side, then replace them with others that were left behind on their way to the end station. He used tools only a string of steel ropes and a few small iron hooks.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): I committed a robbery several times. The robber would steal a section of the trainbeds from the back, preserve the车厢中的货物, and replace the remaining seats with new ones—perfecting the operation with a straightjacket made out of a steel rope and a few iron hooks.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: I handled a theft case where the thief was able to steal one compartment of a train while it was moving along the tracks, then reassemble the rest of the carriages at the end station with just a piece of steel wire and some iron hooks.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): I solved a theft case where the perpetrator had stolen a section of the train mid-journey, replaced it with something identical back at the other end, and then run it all the way to the station. He used only a piece of steel cable and a few clamps.

chinese: 老耿那时已七十多岁，孤身一人，享受“五保”待遇，是村里德高望重的人物，每逢诉苦大会，都要他上台诉苦。 每次诉苦，他都要剥掉上衣，露出一片疤痕。
english: Old Geng, who was already over seventy by then and lived alone as a pensioner, was one of our most revered villagers. Asked to speak at meetings to air grievances against the old order, he invariably stripped to the waist onstage to show his scars.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: The old耿 was seventy years old then, single-handedly living on his own, enjoying "old age pension"待遇， a figure of great respect among villagers. Every time he had a complaining meeting, he would have him take off his clothes revealing his scars.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: Old Geng was a seventy-year-old man, alone and single, and a member of the Poor Man's League at the time. When every member in the league got an opportunity to complain, he always had to stand in front of the audience and peel off his clothes so everyone could see the scar on his chest.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Lao Jing was now seventy years old. He lived alone and enjoyed "five-protected" benefits. He was a respected person in the village. At every complaint meeting, he had to go up on the stage to complain. Each time he complained, he had to take off his shirt and show a scar.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: Old Geng had been alone all his life, enjoying five-star benefits as a deacon in this village where everyone suffered from something. Every month he had to go onto the public platform and complain about his problems, and every month he would take off his shirt to reveal the scars on his back, which told story of his sufferings.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: Old Tang was seventy years old then. He was alone, living off “the five-star pension”, a respected figure in the village, who would often hear him complain at the annual complaint meeting. Every time he complained, he would strip off his clothes and reveal a scar on his back.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): Old Geng was a seventy-year-old man, single-registered without family, a member of the Five Red Beneagues on the village's outskirts. Whenever the meeting for Report on Suffering took place, he would have him take off his shirt and reveal a scar.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: When Old Ge was seventy years old, he lived alone, enjoying "five guards", a person of high reputation in the village, had to speak at the meeting of complaining every time. He always had to take off his shirt and expose a scar.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): Old Geng had been alone all his life, enjoying five-star benefits as a deacon in this small village where everyone suffered from depression, so every time he gave a sufferance speech, they let him stand in front of a audience and just strip himself naked, revealing the scars on his back.

chinese: 这天下午，程先生提前下班，买了菜到王琦瑶处，两人将孩子哄睡了，便一起忙了起来，一边忙一边说话。

unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: This evening, Mr. Chen was supposed to be leaving for work early, but he went out of his way to buy some vegetables at Ougui'er's house. They both got the children asleep, and then they started working together. When they finished, they were talking.

chinese: 青天哟——蓝天哟——花花绿绿的天哟——棒槌哟亲哥哟你死了——可就塌了妹妹的天哟——

"Blue sky - blue clouds - beautiful green fields - hammer - you have died - collapsed your sister's heaven - Please don't be crushed."

chinese: 下午来打针多是在三四点钟，这一小时总空着，只她们俩，面对面地坐。 夏天午间的困盹还没完全过去，禁不住哈欠连哈欠的。 她们强打精神，自己都不知说的什么。 弄口梧桐树上的蝉一迭声叫，传进来是嗡嗡的，也是不清楚。
english: Most of Wang Qiyao's patients came between three and four o'clock, so they had an hour to kill. Sitting across from each other in the lazy summer afternoon, they would stifle their yawns and chatter on without fully realizing what they were talking about, as cicadas droned in the parasol tree at the entrance to the longtang.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: In the afternoon, they come for injections at about 3 o'clock, and it is empty for half an hour, just her and them. The summer morning was still not over, she could not help but groan as she heard them. She was strong-pressed by their spirits, and what she said nothing came out. "The buzzing of a tree with its leaves."
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: In the afternoon they would come for the shots early, about three or four o'clock, when the hour was empty. The two women would sit idly talking, one of them seated against the other, through the sweat of anticipation already worn off their bodies. Notices would spring up from outside walnut tree number on Académie Street,蝉类一直鸣叫不停,但它们却还是睡得十分熟,不知说什么了。
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: She came to get her injection around four or five o'clock in the afternoon. This hour was always empty, just she and him sitting face to face. The summer sleep hadn't completely passed, so she couldn't help yawning all the time. They had to force themselves to talk. The cicadas on a tree outside the window were chirping one after another. The sound was clear as well as loud, but it was unclear what they were saying.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: Usually the patients would come around four or five o'clock. This gave the two nurses time to catch up on their sleep. They were hit with a wave of drowsiness, but could barely keep their eyes open. The cicadas chirped in front of them, and though the nurses tried hard to pay attention, it was impossible to focus because of the continuous buzzing of the insects.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: The afternoon was for injections at four o'clock, and this hour was empty, just her and them sitting side by side. Summer morning’s sleep had not yet completely ended, but she could not help sneezing. It was hot summer evening when they were unable to stay awake. They were always tired even during the daytime. There was no way to know what they said. She kept saying things out of breath, even if she didn’t speak.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): In the afternoon they only do the hour or so of vaccination work indoors, when everyone is inside, except their各自的俩人, sitting together for barely any reason. The summer evening lectures strike at瞌睡时辰, but not until one begins to fully disappear. They don't know what else to say that won't look asleep out front. Their trees outside chirp away like a crew of hundred hordes, and also not entirely clear.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: They usually came at 4 or so in the afternoon, which meant they had an hour of time to kill. Only they two were there, sitting face-to-face with each other. They couldn’t sleep during the midday nap of summer, so they kept on yawning. They tried their best not to fall asleep but still couldn’t help it. The cicadas chirped loudly from a nearby tree. It was unclear whether they were coming through clearly or not.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): Usually patients came for needle pricks around three o'clock in the afternoon, leaving Wang Qiyao and Wu Peizhen there alone for quite some time. At that hour the clinic was empty, just the two of them facing each other, with neither knowing what to say as they fell asleep during their breaks. The tired birdsong from the willow trees outside seemed to add to the ambience of idleness.

chinese: 在校园中，红卫兵、文革工作组、工宣队和军宣队，相互之间都在爆发尖锐的冲突，而每种派别的内部又时时分化出新的对立派系，捍卫着各自不同的背景和纲领，爆发更为残酷的较量。
english: Within the university, intense conflicts erupted between the Red Guards, the Cultural Revolution Working Group, the Workers' Propaganda Team, and the Military Propaganda Team. And each faction divided into new rebel groups from time to time, each based on different backgrounds and agendas, leading to even more ruthless fighting.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: In school, Red Guards, Cultural Revolution Groups, Students' Associations, and the People's Commissars all clash with each other in a fierce conflict that is tearing apart the various factions within each group. They have formed new groups fighting for different backgrounds and principles, resulting in more brutal confrontations.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: In the campus unions, red Guards, factionals, official division, enemy-neutral student organizations, new factions defending different backgrounds and respective revolutionary visions, were constantly warring each other.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: In the campus, rival groups of Red Guards, Cultural Revolution Work Groups, Proletarian Announcing Teams, and Military Announcing Teams were constantly battling each other, and within each group, new opposition factions would emerge from time to time, defending their own different backgrounds and programs, and fighting with greater brutality.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: Throughout the campus, Red Guards, the Workpers, the Entertainments, the Militaries, and even those within each faction fighting internal division were pitting their strength against one another in sharp disputes over ideology and background.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: In campus life, Red Guards, Cultural Revolution Groups, Workers’ Unions, and the Communist Unions all clash internally, each faction developing its own factions and different backgrounds, which then erupts with fierce confrontations.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): In the school, red Guards, Red Workers, fact-based Commission for Education of the Military Commissar, and Commission for Cultural Reconciliation, each between them encompassed a complex of opposing forces, whose main objectives were clearly defined and distinct from one another.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: In campus, Red Guards, Cultural Revolution Work Groups, Proletarian Annunciations and Military Annunciations were all battling fiercely with each other. Each faction had its own rival factions inside it that constantly divided out new rival groups, defending their own different backgrounds and ideologies, and engaging in a more brutal struggle.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): All the student factions were involved in sharp conflicts with one another, both inside the Red Guards and out, as new factions separated to defend different backgrounds and ideologies, engaging in ruthless battles within.

chinese: 韦小宝不明白他说些什么，只是见他神色欢愉，确是解开了心中一件极为难之事，也不禁代他高兴。

'Trust us!' she told him.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: I had guessed a little of what he meant by his words. Because he was aware that his father had given him so much money for buying land. Now he saw that Tuan was doing well with his money, and he couldn't help but feel sorry for himself; secondly, it would be good for him to show off his own modesty. He laughed and said: "Old old you're sure to have your way here.

His wife, it being so known that his husband had in former times sued hard to get land, had indeed been compelled to pay out all the soil available on a contest-rigorous footing for the benefit of four of his sons, and the old man was now in a trousseau for the commendable fact that their case was not unsuccessful; secondly, it appeared to him that if he remained composed, his mother would no longer feel able to press him: hence he made a little giggle and said 'No worries!
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: Zhou Ruye understood immediately that there was more than meets the eye. Because his husband had bought a piece of land several years ago with help from Gou'er, he could not refuse the old man’s request now. He also wanted to show off his own good manners. So he said, “Old Old, you can rest easy.”

And then he would stop in rapt admiration at how far he turned. He may have thought where it was, but he had no idea that the course of the journey was so far.

english: Cao Xueqin in his Nostalgia Studio worked on it for ten years, in the course of which he rewrote it no less than five times, dividing it into chapters, composing chapter headings, renaming it The Twelve Beauties of Jinling, and adding an introductory quatrain.

chinese: 它们是自行其事，你说你的，它说它的，什么样的有公论的事情，在它都是另一番是非。

unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: They do their own thing: you say what you want, they say what they want, so what is right or wrong with them is another matter altogether.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: They do as they please, and you can't expect them to keep you informed; whatever their own secrets may be, they make no public announcements, not even about major events. For them, for what it's worth, there is no such thing as 'global consensus.'

unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): They do what they want, as long as it's not my business! Whatever gets published is completely meaningless; there is no such thing as 'popular sentiment.'

chinese: 此方人家俱用竹篱木壁，也是劫数应当如此，于是接二连三牵五挂四，将一条街烧得如火焰山一般；彼时虽有军民来救，那火已成了势了，如何救得下? 直烧了一夜方息，也不知烧了多少人家。

The burning lasted all night before it ended. No one knows how many houses they had burned.

We must go ahead and build those many thousands of huts ourselves, though—we shall soon burn through them all. After a night or two's work we should be done with it all up.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: This family had used bamboo fences and wooden walls; it was their destiny that they should burn like a fire mountain. At first, some soldiers and civilians came to help but by then the fire was too great for them to put out. They burnt all night long before it finally died down, not knowing how many houses were burned.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): The walls of the longtang here were made of rick竹和木板， this was part of what the Alkali Path system was designed to accommodate. As a result, there followed a chain of two, then three, burnt buildings, with the final one being the entire street. The soldiers and the villagers could hardly contain the flames, which burned all night and claimed many lives.

chinese: 等王琦瑶最终拗不过她，答应换个日子再去的时候，吴佩珍便像又受了一次恩，欢天喜地去找表哥改日子。
english: By the time Wang Qiyao finally gave in and agreed to go some other time, Wu Peizhen was acting as if yet another gift that she herself had to be thankful for had been bestowed upon her, and she ecstatically scurried off to find her cousin to change the date.

That enabled Wu Peizhen to feel like getting a day off easily enough; she just wanted to go, but it seemed to work more than once for her: Wu Peizhen went to see Wu Zhirong once again, delighted by the joy of discovering another set of circumstances suitable for her visit.

chinese: 平安里的一日生计，是在喧嚣之中拉开帷幕；粪车的轱辘声，涮马桶声，几十个煤球炉子在弄堂里升烟，隔夜洗的衣衫也晾出来了，竹竿交错，好像在烟幕中升旗。
english: Mornings, however, begin with night-soil carts, clattering in to collect waste for fertilizer, and the raspy noises of brushes scrubbing out commodes. Amid the smoke of coal burners, laundry soaked overnight is taken out to be hung, banner-like, on bamboo poles.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: The daily life of a place like Peace Village is a stage set for chaos; the creaking sound of a garbage truck, the whirring sound of a toilet, the thick smoke from dozens of coal ball grinders that rise up and out of the alleys, the rustling of the clothes hanging on the bamboo poles as if they were being hoisted by the clouds.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: The lives of people on Peace Lane come to a head when they set forth; every hour brings about another chorus of grinds from the wheelchairs, the lit-washing-beds in the longtang turn the stoves inside into the oven for the night, and the walls between houses wrinkles as the countless pieces rise up in front of our eyes like banners under a curtain.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: A day's wage at Peaceful Street is spent in a cacophony; the sound of a dungcart wheeling around, the noise of a toilet being flushed, dozens of coal stoves firing up smoke as they go about their business in the lanes, and overnight laundry dried out on the rods.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: The hustle and bustle of Peace Lane opens with a quiet scene: gurgling garbage trucks, flushing toilets, stacks of coals in every alley—next morning one can hang out to dry clothes that have been washed the night before. Bamboo poles jostle for space against the misty curtain of smoke.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: The daily life of a village was that of a morning commotion; the engine's rumble, the toilet flushing, the hundred coal-burning stoves in the courtyard, the dried clothes hung out for the night, the bamboo poles swaying like banners in the fog.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): The daily routine of Peace Lane gets started amidst the frenzied activity of other streets; the rascal's wheeltripping sounds; the pitter-patter of dishwashers' detergent bottles as they lifted the day's grease; the smoke from the charcoal-stove filled chimneys rising up the longtang; and the alternating bamboo poles forming a banner as they waved their goods away.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: A day's life at Pingan Street is a curtain raising amidst the din; the wheels of the garbage truck, the sound of flushing toilets, dozens of coal-burning stoves emitting smoke, overnight laundry hanging out to dry, bamboo poles strung together as if raising a flag.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): The life of a one-day tenant is conducted amidst the commotion on Peace Lane. The grinding sounds of the refuse truck wheels against the street are accompanied by the flushing of toilets and the rising smoke from dozens of stoves. Wrinkled clothes hang out to dry at night, like flags in an enigma.

chinese: “审判日”号宽阔的甲板上很空荡，只是后甲板上有一个人在用水龙头冲洗缆桩，汪淼从高处看得很清楚，当船的这一部分从钢柱间移过的瞬间，那人的身体突然僵硬了，水龙头从他手里滑落；与此同时，连接龙头的胶皮水带也在不远处断成两截，水从那里白花花地喷了出来，那人直直地站了几秒钟就倒下了，他的身体在接触甲板的同时分成两截。
english: Judgment Day's wide deck was empty save for one man standing near the stern hosing down the ship's bollards. From his vantage point, Wang saw everything clearly. The moment that that section of the ship passed between the pillars, the hose broke into two pieces not too far from the man, and water spilled out. The man's body stiffened, and the nozzle tumbled from his hand. He remained standing for a few seconds, then fell. As his body contacted the deck, it came apart in two halves.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: The ship's broad deck is empty except for a person cleaning the cable on the stern of the ship. Maoming can see clearly from above. When the part of the ship that was about to cross the steel pillar suddenly stiffened as the ship passed over, his body suddenly became rigid when he raised his hand. The water pipe with the rubber hose attached to it fell out of his hand; water sprayed from its mouth at a steady speed. He stood there for a few seconds before falling down. His body split in half through contact with the deck, his body being separated in two parts at the same time.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: Judgment Day was empty except for the person washing the pylon with the flow of the ship's water hose as it shifted across the top of the ship. Wang could make out the motion; when the other crewman's body broke through the wall, the hose fell from his hand; immediately after, the two ends of the rubber membrane were broken into pieces, causing gurgling water to spill from one of the cracks.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: The broad deck of the "Judgment Day" was empty except for one person washing the mooring cleats with a water hose from the high deck. Huang Mao could see clearly as the ship passed by the steel columns on this section of the deck. The man's body suddenly stiffened when he moved through the space between the decks. A water hose connected to his hand dropped off. At the same time, the rubber water hose near him broke into two pieces, spouting white water out. He stood straight for a few seconds before he fell down, his body split into two parts at the contact with the deck.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: The wide deck of Judgment Day was empty. On the aft superstructure, one person could be seen using a water cleaner to wash the mooring cables. Wang looked down from a high vantage point to see the man stiffen just as the ship's components passed over him, and then the rubber-coated water hose snapped in two near by. Water sprays sprayed white from where it had splashed on to the ground. The man stood for a few seconds before collapsing. His body broke in two as it touched the deck.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: The ship’s broad deck was empty except for a person washing his hands with the tap on the after deck, Yang Minxuan could see clearly from above as he watched the part of the ship that had passed over the steel pillars. The moment the ship’s section moved through the gap between them, the body stiffened when the water pipe fell out of his hand; the water flowed out of the hose at this point, splashing all over the place. He stood straight while touching the deck at the same time. His body split into two sections.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): Judgment Day was empty except for the person on the rear deck cleaning the pylon with a water hose. As the ship moved across the archway between the pillars, Wang could make out the small figure moving along it, frozen until he knew it was dead. When the ship's part of the new steel structure passed close by, the man's body locked up. The hose fell from his hand. As soon as the two ends of the gray, dry rope were broken, sweatdroplets escaped in the distance. Another man stood stiffly on one of the bars, straightened out by the break, before landing right on top of him. His body had been divided into two, like the moisture seeping through between the cracks.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: The wide deck of the "Judgment Day" was empty except for one person who was washing anchor cables with a faucet from the afterdeck. Hu Man understood clearly as he looked down from high above when the ship passed over the steel columns; the man's body stiffened instantly at that moment as if struck by some unseen force, his water faucet falling out of his hand; the nearby rubber hose also snapped in two as it hit the ground, spouting water white as milk from where it split; the man stood straight for several seconds before collapsing. His body split in two as he touched the deck.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): There was a wide expanse of empty land between the superstructures, except for one person who was washing the mooring pins with a water faucet on the aft deck. Wang looked down from a high vantage point and saw the man's body jerk before he collapsed. The faucet fell to the ground as the ship passed over the steel pillars, breaking into two pieces, and white water sprays sprayed up. Wang could see the man's body split in two as it collided with the deck.

chinese: 亚热带旱季的阳光把我晒得浑身赤红，痛痒难当，我的小和尚直翘翘地指向天空，尺寸空前。

unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: The tropical dry season sun burns me raw with ached skin. My monk sticks his finger out skyward. This is unprecedented.

unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): During the dry season, the subtropical sun made me burn all over, and my little Buddha pointed up, ready to depart for eternity.

chinese: 其实伟大友谊不真也不假，就如世上一切东西一样，你信它是真，它就真下去。 你疑它是假，它就是假的。 我的话也半真不假。 但是我随时准备兑现我的话，哪怕天崩地裂也不退却。
english: Actually, the great friendship was neither true nor false, like everything else in the world. It was true if you believed it, and false if you didn't; my words were also neither true nor false, but I was prepared to stand by my words anytime and wouldn't back off even if the sky collapsed and the earth cracked open.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: In fact, great friendship is not genuine nor false; as with everything else in the world, it is true whether you believe it or not. You can be certain of its truth if you believe in it. My words are half true. But I am always prepared to fulfill my words at any time, even when the heavens collapse or break up.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: The great friendship was not fake or worthless. As things go everywhere in the world—books, clothes, glass, gold, etc.—it must be there just as we believe it is; you can't tell it from真假两面; you can怀疑它真还是假，真就是真的，假也是真的。但是我也随时都可以兑现我说的话，即使天塌了我也不能动摇。
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: In fact, great friendship is not real nor false, just like everything else, if you believe it is real, it will be real; if you doubt that it is false, it will be false. My words are also half true. But I am always ready to keep my word, even if the sky falls apart.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: Actually, her friendship was not real nor imaginary; like everything else in this world, as long as you believed it to be real, it would remain that way; as long as you suspected it to be fake, it would fall apart. But my words were semitruthy: I was ready to break the world apart if needed for the sake of keeping a promise.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: In fact, great friendship is not real nor false, just like everything else in the world. You trust it as true, and that will continue on its own course. I speak half truth. But I am ready to fulfill my words at any time. Even if the earth collapses or the sun breaks up, I will not back down.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): The great friendship was not untrue or false; just like everything in the world. You believe it is real, it becomes real. You doubt it is real—it becomes fake. But I am speaking truthfully and slightly false. I can keep talking until the universe collapses—that doesn't mean I won't fail sometimes.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: Actually great friendship is not true nor false; just as all things on earth are, you believe it to be true, it will remain so; you doubt that it is false, it will become false. My words are half true and half false. But I am ready to keep my word at any cost, even if the world ends in a cataclysm.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): Her great friendship, like everything else in this world, was neither true nor false. You could believe it was real, and it would indeed remain real; you could doubt it was fake, and it would then become truly fake. My words could be described as semi-truthful, but I was always ready to back up my words whenever the earth collapsed under me.

english: The slender figure of a beautiful young girl emerged at the top of the building, waving the giant red banner of the April Twenty-eighth Brigade. Her appearance was greeted immediately by a cacophony of gunshots. Together, they formed a condensed version of modern history.

There was also a set of new automatic pistol and冲锋枪，from which the latter was stolen from the military after the Eight-Second Manifestation published in August. chinese: 将她抱起，坐在椅上，说道：“你瞧着，我在你身上各个部位指点，倘若指得对的，你就眨三下眼睛，指得不对，眼睛睁得大大的，一动也不能动。
english: He lifted her up in his arms and sat her down in a chair. 'Now look,' he said, 'I'm going to start pointing to places on your body. If I point to the right place, blink three times; if it isn't right, just keep your eyes open and don't move.

unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: I show you the different parts of your face. First, when I tell you what way you should look at, you must close your eyes only on things that are right. If the thing you looked at didn't seem right, open your eyes again.

unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Good news for those who love computers: it is not as bad as some people make it out to be." The Chinese proverb "A bird in a barrel is sure to get struck by a bolt of lightning" translates to "The barrel of a gun will surely fire bullets". This is because the speed at which the computer's data lines transmit information is much faster than the speed at which light travels through space or time. So if we assume that every person on the planet can communicate with each other instantaneously over their line of sight, then the speeds of the data packets would be very different from what you would expect in reality. chinese: 她家先生一九四九年前是一爿灯泡厂的厂主，公私合营后做了副厂长，照严家师母的话， 就是摆摆样子的。
english: Her husband had owned a light bulb factory that, since 1949, was jointly operated with the state. He was now the deputy manager—a mere figurehead, according to Madame Yan.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: She was a shopkeeper at his father's factory from 1949 until he became a member of the Communist Party. He was considered "a figure" by his mother-in-law when she told him that was what it meant.

unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Her husband was a factory manager from 1949 to the early years of the Cultural Revolution before it was converted to a joint venture. According to her aunt, he just did that for show.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: Her husband had been the manager of a lamp factory before the revolution. After state-owned enterprises were nationalized, he became the deputy manager, just to keep up the appearance.

chinese: 于是她用和解的口气说：不管怎么说，这东西丑得要命，你承不承认？

chinese: 因此，他们无名无姓的，默默耕耘着自己的一方田地。

chinese: 只觉天涯茫茫，到处是鞑子的天下，真无一片干净土地，沉吟道：“桃源何处，可避暴秦？
english: The whole world belonged to the Tartars now, it seemed. Not a single patch of land was free of their hated presence. unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Only felt that the world was empty of lands under the yoke of the Turks, where there was no place for a peaceful existence. "Where is the paradise?" he muttered.

unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): But everywhere he looked it was the Tartar way of life; and truly there is not a clean, beautiful place on this vast earth to hide oneself in. 'How can I avoid the treacherous Qinistan?'
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: I felt that the world was full of Yuan controls, and there were no clean lands anywhere, so I said with a sigh: "Where is the place for hiding from the tyrannical Qin?"
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): His thoughts were reeling with images of Tartar rule everywhere he looked. There was not a clean shaven patch anywhere. He said wistfully, 'Ah, sweet beauty, how oft have I heard of that idyllic home where man is free from the hand of the tyrant?

chinese: 有时你会觉着那里比较嘈杂，推开窗便噪声盈耳，你不要怪它，这就是简约人生聚沙成塔的动静。 他们毕竟是活泼泼的，也是要有些声响的。

chinese: 突然心想：“满洲武士打不过茅大哥，茅大哥又不是老乌龟的对手，何不骗得老乌龟教我些本事？”

unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): Suddenly he had a little smile on his face. Well, Old Big Beaver wasn't got a big head himself, so who was there to beat him up? english: Her delicate little pink-and-white face seemed dearer to him than ever at that moment, and he stretched out his arms to take her and hugged her to him. After playing with her for a while at his desk, he carried her out to the front of the house to watch the bustle in the street.

chinese: 那种有前客堂和左右厢房里的流言是要老派一些的，带薰衣草的气味的；而带亭子间和拐角楼梯的弄堂房子的流言则是新派的，气味是樟脑丸的气味。
english: The kind of gossip exchanged in the front rooms and adjoining wings belongs to the old school and smacks faintly of potpourri. The gossip in the rooftop tingzijian and staircases is new school and smells of mothballs.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: That is a rumor that flows from the old guesthouse and the room on one side and on the other. It has the scent of lavender; while it's a rumor about the house with a garden room and staircases at the corner or corners, it has the scent of樟脑丸.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: Gossip coming from outside the main reception room fills the streets with a priora odor; the fragrance of daisies gives it the name Dachsa's Room. unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: The gossip that involves a courtyard with front hall and side rooms is older, with the smell of lavender; while the gossip involving a house with a shed and corner stairs is new, with the scent of camphor.

chinese: 只是父亲、伯叔、兄弟之伦，因是圣人遗训，不敢违忤，所以弟兄间亦不过尽其大概就罢了，并不想自己是男子，须要为子弟之表率。
english: Only in the case of his father, uncles and brother, where rudeness and disobedience were expressly forbidden by the teachings of Confucius, did he make an exception – and even then the allowances he made in respect of the fraternal bond were extremely perfunctory. It certainly never occurred to him that his own maleness placed him under any obligation to set an example to the younger males in his clan.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Just fathers, brothers, and cousins, which is according to the Fathers' instruction, I cannot violate or contradict it, so the brothers also do not have to go into great detail, but just want to give them a rough idea.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: I follow the sacred traditions of the family which states that a man's place is to be son of God and not to denitrify his own status by giving his sons the same precedence as men. So when it comes to my relationship with my grandchildren I make no attempt to go over much, merely trying to set them straight on their parentage.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Just like father, elder brother, and brotherhood, they were bound by Confucius' teachings and could not violate them, so between brothers, it was enough for them to just get a glimpse of what is appropriate. They did not think that as men, they needed to be role models for their younger siblings.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: But as Longer or Cousin were圣人的教诲， they had no need to disregard them; so, generally speaking, the brothers and sisters of these generations were able to carry on the family legacy, giving roughly construed versions of what would have otherwise been much more extensive and ornate accounts. We should be foolish if we thought that being a son or grandson we had to behave like an elder. It is enough for us simply to be ourselves, however.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: Only the father, uncle, brotherhood, is forbidden to contradict or dissent from the ancient teachings of the Buddha, so there is no need to go into detail about them, but just want to make up for what you have done and not be a man to your children.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): As far as I am, ' said Father, 'the rules by which Brother Qian's life has been lived since there is not to allow him to deviation. And so when it comes to my children, I leave almost everything to them to define me. I have no means of influencing them at all, save to say this: I wish them good luck. That is their duty, I think.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: Only father, brother, and cousins, because they are inheritors of Confucius' teachings, dare not disobey them, so brothers simply abide by their general rules, without wanting to be a model for their children as men.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): But it was modelled on the principles laid down by Confucius, and for that reason a son did not dare to违背 these. In fact, however, the rules of behaviour in this case were only sketchy. He was conscious, however, that he was no ordinary son, and that he therefore had the duty of being an example to his brothers.

chinese: 阮雯曾留学剑桥，她的家曾对叶文洁充满了吸引力，那里有许多从欧洲带回来的精致的书籍、油画和唱片，一架钢琴；还有一排放在精致小木架上的欧式烟斗，父亲那只就是她送的，这些烟斗有地中海石楠根的，有土耳其海泡石的，每一个都仿佛浸透了曾将它们拿在手中和含在嘴里深思的那个男人的智慧，但阮雯从未提起过他。
english: Ruan had studied at Cambridge University, and her home had once fascinated Wenjie: refined books, paintings, and records brought back from Europe; a piano; a set of European-style pipes arranged on a delicate wooden stand, some made from Mediterranean briar, some from Turkish meerschaum. Each of them seemed suffused with the wisdom of the man who had once held the bowl in his hand or clamped the stem between his teeth, deep in thought, though Ruan had never mentioned the man's name. The pipe that had belonged to Wenjie's father had in fact been a gift from Ruan.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Xun Weilai once studied at Cambridge and her family attracted her there because she had a lot of exquisite books, paintings and records from Europe, including a small wooden piano with a Mediterranean rockstone inside it; also there was a row of French cigars, one that was hers, each one seemed to be imbued with the wisdom of the man who held them in his hand and took them in his mouth. But she never mentioned him.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: Fu Yan had studied at Cambridge, and her family had always liked that city environment where books were rare but beautiful paintings were on display and small albums, and so on were placed on high wooden stands. Her father had gotten a Swiss Bachman zither when they displayed it for her. Each of these zithers had been from Italy's Mediterranean, or Brazil's Alhambú, and the sound was as cool as holding it in her hands and inhaling deeply. She'd never mentioned him.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Nang Wen had studied at Cambridge and her family was attracted by it for its many European books, paintings, and records, a piano; also there were elegant wooden frames containing French-made pipes that had been passed around among them; they all seemed to be imbued with the wisdom of the man who once held them in his hands and chewed on them thoughtfully. But Nang Wen never spoke of him.
